summarized_judgment: kumar bijan kr. ( cj ) j. ( mukherjea c. j. ), vivian jagannadhadas, b. aiyyar, t. l. venkatarama sinha, bhuvneshwar. ( bj ) gandhi memorial medical college indore.

tagline: Nanak Chand vs The State Of Punjab on 25 January, 1955
summarized_judgment: no offence created there by - ss. 34 and 149 of the indian penal code - distinction between the two - code of criminal procedure ( act v of 1898 ) the two sections are not to be confused. the principal element in s. 34 is the common intention to commit a crime.

tagline: Ameer-Un-Nissa Begum & Ors vs Mahboob Begum & Ors on 14 January, 1955
summarized_judgment: ameer - un - nissa begum & ors... ands. the case no longer has been heard in the u. s. for more than 40 years. the petitioner has been accused of being a victim of a gang of over - 65s.

tagline: Girja Datt Singh vs Gangotri Datt Singh on 25 January, 1955
summarized_judgment: two appeals by special leave arise out of two separate proceedings. one under the u. p. encumbered estates act, e. e. act case no. 11 of 1936 and the other a title suit. the deceased died on 15 - 5 - 1933 leaving him surviving bhaiya girja datt singh.

tagline: Mahant Salig Ram vs Musammat Maya Devi on 21 January, 1955
summarized_judgment: the general custom of punjab is entitled to an initial presumption in favour of the daughter's succession to the self - acquired property of her father. it is well - settled that a daughter excludes the collaterals from succession to self acquired property. general custom is based in gurdaspur district of the punjab, where the riwaj - i - am is opposed to the custom.

tagline: Amrik Singh vs The State Of Pepsu on 28 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: aiyyar, t. l. venkatarama das, sudhi ranjan bhagwati, natwarlal h. velkar. court heard that sanction is necessary for prosecution under s. 197 ( 1 ) of the code of criminal procedure. if asked, it could be claimed to have been done by virtue of the office, sanction would be necessary.

tagline: The Automobile Products Of India ... vs Rukmaji Bala And Others(And ... on 3 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: sudhi ranjan bhagwati, natwarlal h. imam, syed jaffervedi and others. the two now ss. 33 and 33 - a inserted in the industrial di - - putes act 1947 ( xiv of 1947 ) by act xlviii of 1950 ( xx of 1950 ) confers on the 1242 workmen an additional remedy.

tagline: Hans Muller Of Nurenburg vs Superintendent, Presidency ... on 23 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: petitioner was placed under pre - ventive detention act 1950 on the ground that he was a foreigner within the meaning of the foreigners act 1946. the petitioner, a west german subject, was placed in pre - term detention by an order of the west bengal government under s. 3 ( 1 ) of the tourists act.

tagline: The Collector Of Bombay vs Nusserwanji Rattanji Mistri & ... on 28 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: in the island of bombay certain lands were held on a tenure known as " foras " under s. 2 of bombay act vi of 1851, occupants were entitled to hold the lands subject only to the payment of revenue then payable. in 1942 the appellant acting under the. foras land act ( bombay act ii of 1876 ) issued notices to the respondents proposing to levy assessment on the lands at the rates mentioned therein.

tagline: Rishideo Pande vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 3 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: the high court gave banslochan the benefit of doubt and rejected the reference and allowed the appeal so far as it concerned him. the appeal is by rishideo alone. the main point urged by sri umrigar who appears in support of this appeal is that section 34 have been wrongly applied to the facts.

tagline: Shyabuddinsab Mohidinsab Akki vs The Gadag-Betgeri Municipal ... on 22 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: the first respondent - municipality governed by the municipal boroughs act, 1925 ( bombay act xviii of 1925 ) consists of 32 councillors, s, ( the appellant ) being one of them. the last general election to the municipality took place on the 7th may 1951. the term of respondents 4 and 5 was to expire at the end of three years.

tagline: Sri 5 Sita Maharani And Ors. vs Chhedi Mahto And Ors. on 3 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: a court granted a certificate for leave to appeal the court's decision. raja mohan bikram shah was the proprietor of the ramnager raj. the land in suit appertains to khata no. 2 of village ratni for a period of 31 years. they had pleaded adverse possession but this plea was abandoned at the trial.

tagline: The State Of Bihar vs Kumar Amar Singh And Others(And ... on 10 February, 1955

tagline: Sm. Ram Devi vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 22 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant along with 5 other persons was charged under section 366, penal code, for kidnapping or abducting one chameli, a minor daughter of a railway employee one net ram, in order she may be forced or seduced to illicit intercourse. both were also charged with having committed offences under various sections of the penal code.

tagline: Gurbakhsh Singh vs State Of Punjab on 16 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment s. r. das, j. 1. gurbakhsh singh, piara singh and his brother's son jawahri were sent up for trial. additional sessions judge acquitted labh singh under section 302 and section 307. the high court has dismissed his appeal and accepted the reference the present appeal.

tagline: State Of Bombay vs Mulji Jetha And Co. on 10 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: two appeals on leave granted by the high court of bombay under article 133 ( 1 ) ( c ) of the constitution against its common judgment in second appeals nos. 936 and 937 of 1947. the appellant in each appeals is the state of bombay and the respondent is mulji jetha.

tagline: Ram Narain vs State Of Punjab on 11 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant was posted as an accountant in ferozpore district. on 7 - 2 - 1950 he withdrew from the treasury a sum of rs. 11, 579 - 8 - 0 on the strength of a contingent voucher being a subsistence allowance bill for the month of february, 1950. appellant is charged that he fraudulently fraudulently and dishonestly used as forged document.

tagline: Sangram Singh vs Election Tribunal, Kotah,Bhurey ... on 22 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: bose, vivian benchmark of the people act ( act xliii ) of 1951, section 105 effect of - finality and conclusiveness of orders of election tribunals. supreme court and supreme court have unfettered jurisdiction to examine whether the tribunal has acted legally or otherwise. high courts and justices can determine what the law of the land is vis - a - vis allegation.

tagline: Seth Thawardas Pherumal vs The Union Of India(And Connected ... on 24 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: both parties specifically refer a question of law for the decision of arbitrator - case. but both parties are bound by his decision on a number of grounds. but a distinction must be drawn between cases in which a dispute is covered by it. the union of india, which contested the award, contested award on grounds. it is not enough for the contract to provide for arbitration, more is necessary.

tagline: Sahu Madho Das And Others vs Pandit Mukand Ram And Another(And ... on 22 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: a compromise or family arrangement is based on assumption that there is an antecedent title of some sort in the parties. it is assumed that the title claimed by the person receiving the property under the arrangement had always lived in him or her so far as the property falling to his share and recognising the right of the others, as they had previously claimed it.

tagline: Jugalkishore Saraf vs Raw Cotton Co. Ltd on 7 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: application by transferee - applicability of order xxi, rule 16 and s. 146 - equitable principles transfer of property act ( iv of 1882 ), ruled 16 - debt transferred pending suit thereon - decree not. mentioned in deed - execution of the appellant. h & s filed suit against appellant for recovery of money and during pendency of suit.

tagline: U.J.S. Chopra vs State Of Bombay on 25 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant was convicted by the presidency magistrate of an offence under s. 66 ( b ) of the bombay prohibition act ( act xxv of 1949 ) he preferred an appeal to high court for enhancement of sentence notice issued to appellant to show cause against his conviction. appellant's appeal was dismissed summarily - after summary dismissal of appeal.

tagline: A.V. D'Costa vs B. C. Patel And Another on 4 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: second respondent had been employee of the central railway as a daily rated casual labourer on specified daily wages since 1941. he continued to receive his wages at the specified rate until 1949. in october 1949 he made an application through an official of the registered trade union - a person permitted under sub - section of s. 5 or s. 7 of act.

tagline: Shivnandan Sharma vs The Punjab National Bank Ltd on 15 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant was appointed head cashier in one of the branches of the respondent bank by the treasurers who were in charge of the bank by virtue of an agreement between them. the question arose as to whether the appellant wasn't an employee. if a master employs a servant and authorizes him to employ a number of persons to do a particular job.

tagline: Suraj Pal vs The State Of Uttar Pradesh on 1 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: v. 302 and 307 of the code - legality - code of criminal procedure. the absence of specific charges in this case is a serious lacunas in the proceedings, inasmuch as the framing of a specific and distinct charge in respect of every distinct head of criminal liability constituting an offence.

tagline: The Divisional Engineer, G.I.P. ... vs Mahadeo Raghoo And Another on 2 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: first respondent drew this'allowance along with salary up to the 18th august 1948, when he refused to occupy the quarter offered to him. but he was offered a house rent allowance and home rent allowance was stopped from the date of his refusal. it is no more payable under the terms of the contract, but the allowance will not be admissible to those who occupy government quarters.

tagline: The State Of Bihar vs M. Homi And Another on 24 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: the sureties were entirely misconceived as the penalty stipulated had not been incurred. ali khan's appeal to the privy council was dismissed by the federal court. there is no room for the application of a legal fiction that the judgment of the court must be deemed to be the judgment or order.

tagline: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak ... vs Raja Shiv Rattan Dev Singh And Ors. on 24 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment jagannadhadas, j. 1, is an appeal from the judgment of the high court of punjab by leave. the appeal was filed in 1938 by the respondent herein, raja shiv rattan dev singh, raja of poonch. the case was remanded on first appeal and returned the case back to court.

tagline: N. Satyanathan vs K. Subramanyan And Others on 29 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: the appellant entered into agreement with central government for conveying postal articles and mail bags through motor vehicle se? vice on certain remuneration - appellant whether disqualified for election to house of people under s. 7 ( d ) of the act, 1951 ( act xliii ) of 1951. appellant had offered to contract with the governor - general for the provision of a motor vehicle service for the transit conveyance of all postal.

tagline: Bhim Sen vs The State Of U. P on 15 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: india's state of u. s. p. and third belonged to madhya pradesh state. section 52 ( 1 ) of the act provides certain specified offences ( including theft when the value of stolen property does 1445 not exceed rs. 50 / - a certain offence will be cognizable under the act by the panchayat adalat.

tagline: Dhirendra Nath Mitra And Anr. vs Mukanda Lal Sen on 1 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: four persons, including the two appellants, were prosecuted at the instance of a private complainant. chunder, j., issued rules against three of the accused but refused to issue one against the fourth. the complaintant applied in revision against the acquittals to the high court. the first accused obtained a decree authorising him to demolish certain huts in her possession.

tagline: Dasrath Gond And Ors. vs State Of Orissa on 15 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment jagannadhadas, j. 1, was admitted only on the question of sentence. in the early part of the year 11952 small pox epidemic was prevalent in a virulent form in the village of badimal p. s. brajarajnagar, in sambalpur district.

tagline: Shiromani Gurdwara ... vs Lt. Sardar Raghbir Singh And ... on 24 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: a - committee constituted prior to the year 1930 - subsequent proceedings - high court's decision and notification under s. 17 of the act - suit for possession - starting point for limitation - ss. 85, 86, 88 of act's act, which means the present suit is barred by limitation. section 86 does not apply to gurudwara sri akal takht sabib.

tagline: Rai Sahib Ram Jawaya Kapur And Ors. vs The State Of Punjab on 12 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: petition under article 32 of the constitution is preferred by six persons who purport to carry on the business. petitioners pray for writs in the nature of mandamus directing punjab government to withdraw notifications. the education department has issued a series of notifications since 1950 regarding printing, publication and sale of these books.

tagline: M. K. Ranganathan And Another vs Government Of Madras And Others on 20 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: secured creditor is outside winding up and can realism his security without leaving court of any of the properties of the company'added in s. 232 ( 1 ) by the amending act xxii of 1936 have been used in juxtaposition with " any attachment, distress or execution put into force without leave of the court'it is also a well - recognized rule of construction that legislature does not intend to make a substantial alteration in the law beyond what it explicitly declares either in express words or by clear meaning.

tagline: Messrs Chatturam Horilram Ltd vs Commissioner Of Income Tax, Bihar ... on 18 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: indian finance act of 1939 brought into force retrospectively by bihar regulation iv of 1942. but that assessment was set aside by the income tax appellate tribunal on the ground that was not in force during the assessment year in chota nagpur. the appellant in this appeal had been assessed to income tax which was reduced on appeal.

tagline: Thakur Amar Singhji vs State Of Rajasthan(And Other ... on 15 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: rajasthan land reforms and resumption of jagirs act was approved by the rajpramukh on 8 - 2 - 1952. it came into force on 18 - 2 1952, and reserved for the consideration of the president who gave his assent to it on 13 - 2, 1952. in pursuance of s. 21 ( 1 ) of the act, the act came to be enacted in the ministerial department of rajasthan.

tagline: Anil Behari Ghosh vs Smt. Latika Bala Dassi And Others on 15 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: supreme court may refuse to grant annulment in cases where there is no likelihood of proof being offered that the will admitted to probate was either not genuine or had not been validly executed. india's supreme court was not satisfied that in all the circumum - stances of the present case just cause for the annullion of the grant of probate.

tagline: Rai Sahib Ram Jawaya Kapurand ... vs The State Of Punjab(And Connected ... on 22 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: the government approved some books on each subject as alternative text books. in 1952 a notification was issued by the government which omitted the word " publishers and authors " the government charged as royalty 5 % on the sale price of all the approved texts. the petitioners purport to carry on the business of preparing, printing, publishing and selling of the books.

tagline: The Registrar Of Trade Marks vs Ashok Chandra Rakhit Ltd on 15 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: sudhi ranjan bhagwati, natwarlal h. sinha, bhuvneshwar p, was the registrar of trade marks. registrar under s. 13 of the act is always a matter of discretion to be exercised, according to sound principles laid down for exercise of all judicial discretion.

tagline: The Delhi Cloth And General Mills ... vs Harnam Singh And Others on 21 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: cloth rationed at lyallpur, then part. of punjab in undivided india, and sales could only be made to government nominees and other authorised persons. cloth supplied the plaintiffs with cloth from time to time in accordance with government quota through branch manager. cloth was rationed to a part of the punjab in india and became " evacuees " in 1947.

tagline: Maharaj Umeg Slng And Others vs The State Of Bombay And Others on 6 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: goaraj umeg slng, natwarlal h. mukherjee and bhagwati are among the subjects of the indian state of bombay. clause 5 of the letters of guarantee itself saved the legislative right of the state subject to the limitation that enactments of state shall not be discriminatory in nature.

tagline: Director Of Endowments ... vs Akram Ali on 22 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: akram ali date of judgment in india's supreme court. he was given the chance to attend the hearing on the death penalty. the case is expected to be heard at the supreme court next month. india ’ s president has been given a six - month conditional discharge in the case.

tagline: Ram Shankar Singh And Ors. vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 19 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment sinha, j. 1, is an appeal by special leave from the judgment and order of a single judge confirming those of sessions judge of azamgarh. on appeal, the learned judge acquitted three of them but maintained the conviction and sentence of the three appellants. the dacoits beat the complainant, some of them kept watch on the three.

tagline: Raj Kali Kuer vs Ram Rattan Pandey on 7 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: though a female is personally disqualified from officiating as a pujari for the shastrically installed and installed idols in the temples. the practice is not contrary to written hindu law nor opposed to public policy. the high court of patna reversed the judgment of the high - court reversed.

tagline: Rao Shiva Bahadur Singh vs The State Of Vindhya Pradesh And ... on 5 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: lokomo bahadur singh, bijan kr. ( cj ) das, sudhi ranjan bose, vivian sinha, bhuvneshwar p. ( bj ) gandhi, and imam jj. sinha j. dissenting : the whole matter is not repugnant to the constitution or the general principles of procedural law.

tagline: Om Prakash Gupta vs The State Of Uttar Pradesh on 21 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant, a member of the united provinces civil service, was suspended from service with effect from the 24th august, 1944, pending an enquiry into his conduct. the appellant was given an alternative prayer for a declaration that the order of dismissal was 50 392 wrongful and for a decree for rs. 1, 20, 000 / - by way of damages passed in his favour.

tagline: Rao Shiva Bahadur Singh vs The State Of Vindhya Pradesh And ... on 7 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment das, j. 1, is a petition for a writ in the nature of a writ. the facts leading up to the present petition are few and simple. petitioner's grievance is that he has been deprived of his liberty otherwise than in accordance with law law.

tagline: Shiva Jute Baling Ltd vs Hindley & Co. Ltd on 5 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: petitioners in case of an appellant for rescinding special leave under article 136 of the constitution procedure. petitioners furnished security amounts directed to be deposited within the time specified in the order. the application in the high court was kept pending until january 11, 1955. the petitioners were moved to the supreme court complaining of default on the part of the appellants in due prosecutions.

summarized_judgment: the appellant was able to withdraw from pakistan an amount in the neighbourhood of rs. 9, 00, 000, but there were no prospects of any money coming from pakistan after september 30, 1952, on pakistan's export of capital. but the app depots were locked up in pakistan and it was impossible for appellant to withdraw this amount.

tagline: The State Of Uttar Pradesh vs Mohammad Nooh on 30 September, 1957

tagline: Kushal Rao vs The State Of Bombay on 25 September, 1957

summarized_judgment: the appellant, a pakistani national doing business in karachi, was convicted of cheating under s. 420 of the indian penal code - legality - offendey extradited and brought to india arrest for a fresh offence and conviction - - validity - - charge. he was found guilty of the offence under the lndian penal code in 1881.

tagline: Subramania Goundan vs The State Of Madras on 17 September, 1957

summarized_judgment: j was managing director of a co - operative bank getting a yearly remuneration of rs. 1, 000. the bank went into liquidation and an examination of the affairs showed that j was negligent in the discharge of his duties. the sale was challenged on the grounds that j incurred the interest which j incurred was not binding on the joint family.

tagline: Sri Baru Ram vs Shrimati Prasanni & Others on 30 September, 1958
summarized_judgment: first respondent filed an election petition against the 1404 appellant on the grounds that he committed the corrupt practice specified in s. 123 ( 7 ) of the representation of the people act, 195i. inasmuch as he had obtained the assistance of one p, a member of the armed forces, who had acted as his polling agent. the high court found that p had signed the form a pointing him as the appellant's polling agent and had signed form in token of such appointment.

tagline: Radha Sundar Dutta vs Mohd. Jahadur Rahim And Others on 18 September, 1958
summarized_judgment: chaukidari chakaran lands in lot ahiyapur, part of the permanently settled estate of burdwan. some time before the enactment of the bengal patni section of india's patni district was granted to the predecessors - in - title of defendants who were the then holders of the village.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax vs Bhurangya Coal Co. on 23 September, 1958
summarized_judgment: judgment venkatarama aiyar, j. 1, is an appeal against the high court of patna in a reference under section 66 ( 1 ) of the indian income - tax act, 1922. there is a schedule attached to the deed of agreement and thereunder are set out in great detail.

tagline: Maharaj Kumar Kamal Singh vs The Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 1 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: gajendragadkar, p. b. aiyyar, t. c. benchmarked for income - tax act, 1922, as amended by act 48 of 1948, s. 34 ( 1 % ) act. indian income tax officer excluded interest on arrears of rent payable in respect of agricultural land was neither rent nor revenue derived from land.

tagline: Y. Narayana Chetty & Another vs The Income-Tax Officer, Nellore ... on 15 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: two persons formed a partnership firm on april 20, 1941, and it was dissolved on march 31, 1949. all three firms were carrying on business in yarn and cloth and all of them were registered under s. 26 - a of the income - tax act. the high court dismissed the petitions but granted certificates of fitness to appeal 190 under art.

tagline: Chennuru Gavararaju Chetty vs Chennuru Silaramamurty Chetty ... on 6 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: the appellant, defendant no. 1, obtained a 17 - year lease of a salt factory from the government and the license to manufacture and sell salt under the madras salt act, 1889. the government changed old policy of granting leases to the highest bidders and adopted one of renewing them in favour of previous lessees in whom they had confidence.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs Rai Bahadur Jairam Valji And ... on 7 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: the indian iron and steel company had been carrying on business in the produc - tion and supply of limestone since 1920. the respondent had the right to work other quarries of his own and supply limestone so quarried therefrom to other purchasers. indian iron company took over all the assets and liabilities of the former company.

tagline: M.C. V. S. Arunachala Nadar Etc vs The State Of Madras & Others on 6 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: madras commercial crops markets act provides satisfactory conditions for the growers of commercial crops to sell their produce on equal terms with the purchasers and at reasonable prices. the act provides reasonable restrictions on the citizen's right to do business and are valid. the law and bye - laws framed thereunder have a long term target of providing a net work of markets.

tagline: P. Krishna Menon vs The Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 7 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: the assessee was teaching his disciples vedanta philosophy without any intent of making a profit out of such activity. it was contended that he was not liable to tax on the amounts received as he was carrying on a vocation. in the case of a voluntary payment, no tax can be levied on it if it was made because of the office or the vocation of the donee.

tagline: Pranab Kumar Mitra vs The State Of West Bengal And ... on 3 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: petitioner, who was convicted under s. 420 of the indian penal code, has been sentenced to suffer one day's imprisonment. there is no provision in the code of criminal procedure which limits the discretionary power given by the high court. petitioner's son applied to be substituted as a party in order that he could challenge the order of conviction.

tagline: S. Pl. Narayanan Chettiar vs M. Ar. Annamalai Chettiar on 31 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: the appellant and brother were directed to pay a certain amount to the respondent. appellants were directed at the trial court for scaling down the decremental debt under s. 19 of the main act enabled decrees passed after the commencement of the act to be scaled down under the provisions of act.

tagline: The Commissioner Of ... vs Sri Ramakrishna Deo on 14 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: indian income tax act, 1922, was exempt from payment of income - tax under s. 4 ( 3 ) ( 1 ) of the act. supreme court ruled that the act was not agricultural. and that it was a result of the high court's decision to authorize the case. but the supreme court was able to establish it.

tagline: Sri Dwarka Nath Tewari & Ors vs State Of Bihar & Ors on 13 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: state of bihar & ors, ors. nath tewari and ors's. judgment is expected to fetch more than £80, 000 in a year. the petition is expected in the uk on march 1. it will be held in the capital of bihar and the state of india.

tagline: Mckenzie & Co. Ltd vs Its Workmen And Others on 17 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: workmen illegally confined work manager and went on strike. the company issued notices to the workmen to resume work immediately but they refused. the workers were found guilty of gross misconduct amounting to major misdemeanour. the order was upheld in appeal by the labour appellate tribunal.

tagline: Messrs. Dhandhania Kedia & Co vs The Commissioner Of Income-Tax on 17 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: appellant, a resident of the once independent state of udaipur, held 266 shares in the mewar industries ltd., a company registered in that state. the appellant distributed a portion of the assets among shareholders. appellant's income - tax act was defined in s. 2 ( 6a ) of the indian income tax act. in the present case there had been no law imposing a tax before april 1, 1950that for the first time.

tagline: Smt. Indermani Jatia vs Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 3 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: gajendragadkar kept a central set of accounts of the business at khurja and aligarh in indian state of bahawalpur. the assessee conceded that as creditor he had the right to enforce the payment of interest in british india and that liability of the chistian shop had been extinguished to the 46 extent of interest paid by it to the head office.

tagline: The Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs The Delhi Flour Mills Co., Ltd., ... on 3 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: excess profits tax payable by the company should be deducted from its profits for the purpose of arriving at the annual net profits of which a percentage should be paid to the managing agents as their commission under the agreement. the words " net profits " in the agreement meant divisible profits divisive between the company and managing agents.

tagline: Kochu Govindan Kaimal & Others vs Thayankoot Thekkot Lakshmi Amma ... on 1 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: the properties were held by the testators at, tenants - in - common and the legatees mentioned in the will would become entitled to the properties of the testator who dies. two testators had died the third claimed he had become entitled by surviorship to all the properties.

tagline: The State Of Uttar Pradesh vs Bansraj(And Connected Appeal) on 9 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: drivers, not owners, were found driving motor vehicles in contravention of the'permits granted under s. 42 ( 1 ) of the motor vehicles act. they were prosecuted and sentenced to pay fine. the high court held that under's 42 of the laws of the permit.

tagline: The Commissioner Of ... vs Messrs. Vyas & Dotiwala on 3 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: deputy commissioner of amraoti changed a scheme for distribution of standard cloth. he was responsible for the sale of cloth at prices fixed by the deputy commissioner through the districtdars. he paid 4 - 1 / 2 % of the ex - mill price to the asses - sees for contingent expenses of working the scheme.

tagline: Shree Vinod Kumar & Others vs State Of Himachal Pradesh(And ... on 10 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: the impugned act was introduced as a bill in the first session of the legislative assembly of the old himachal pradesh, elected under the government of part c states act ( 49 of 1951 ) it was passed by the state of heachal pradesh and bilaspur ( new state ) act ( 32 of 1954 ) in july, 1954, abolishing the old act and unite the two states into one.

tagline: Dr. Y. S. Parmar vs Shhira Singh Paul And Another on 17 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: appellant, who was a candidate for election to parlia - ment, signed a very large number of blank forms for the appointment of polling agents and made them over to one kalyan singh after inserting therein the name of a particular polling station. the appellant signed the form of a polling agent and made it over to an appellant's polling agent. it was declared elected but on an election petition being filed his election.

tagline: Rajputana Agencies Ltd vs Commissioner Of I. T., Bombay on 9 October, 1958
summarized_judgment: gajendragadkar, a private company in saurashtra, was assessed for the assessment year 1952 - 53 on a total income of rs. 26, 385. it was assessable at the rate of four annas per rupee but in view of the provisions of the part b states ( taxation concession ) order, 1950.

summarized_judgment: onus must be on the propounder to explain them to the satis - faction of the court before the will can be accepted as genuine. if the test fails, the test should be one of satisfaction of a prudent mind in such matters. the onus will be on propounders to explain their fate before the hearing.

tagline: Gullapalli Nageswara Rao And ... vs Andhra Pradesh State Road ... on 5 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: andhra pradesh state transport undertaking published a scheme under s. 68c of the motor vehicles act. under the act 100 of 1956, state trans - port undertakings approved by government - procedure. if approved, the scheme could be approved by the state government, if approved by state government.

tagline: G. Venkataswami Naidu & Co vs The Comm1Ssioner Of Income-Tax on 24 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: appellant purchased plots of land adjoining the mills on various dates between 1941 and 1942, and about five years later sold them to the mills. the appellant realised a sum of rs. 43, 887 in excess of the purchase price, for the assessment year of judgment.

tagline: Basheshar Nath vs The Commissioner Of ... on 19 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: the appellant's case was on july 22, 1948, referred by the central government under s. 5 ( 1 ) of the act to investigate the case. the commission considered the report's conclusion to the hearing of the constitution - settlement of case - - and whether the waiver of a fundamental right was permissible under the constitution.

tagline: Sri Ram Ram Narain Medhi vs The State Of Bombay(And Connected ... on 18 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: the petition challenged the constitutional validity of the bombay tenancy and agricultural lands act, 1956. the petitions challenged the validity of indian land reform and agricultural land reform. the petition was challenged by sri ram ram ram narain medhi. the application was rejected by the indian state of bombay for the first time.

tagline: N. T. Veluswami Thevar vs G. Raja Nainar And Others on 24 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: the nomination paper of the fourth respondent was rejected by the returning officer on the ground as he was the headmaster of a government - aided school he was disqualified under s. 7 ( d ) and ( e ) of the representation of the people act, 1951 ( 43 of 1951 ), to be chosen for election. it was open to the parties to raise grounds of disqualification not raised before returning officer.

tagline: Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... vs S.Teja Singh on 5 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: indian income - tax act, 1922, was imposed on him for the years 1948 - 49 and 1949 - but failed to send estimate of income tax on income to be sent under s. 18a ( 3 ) of the act. in view of the legal fiction, the court agreed with the view that the act was ultra vires on the ground that s. 28 would apply only when a person failed to furnish the return when he was required so to do by notice.

tagline: Thomas Dana vs The State Of Punjab(And Connected ... on 4 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: the petitioners were convicted and sentenced by the additional district magistrate to various terms of imprisonment under s. 23. they were convicted of attempting to smuggle a huge amount of indian and foreign currency and other contraband goods out of india and the collector of central excise and land customs. a subsequent complaint was made by customs authorities on the same facts.

tagline: The Special Land Acquisition ... vs T. Adinarayan Setty on 7 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: the special land acquisition officer held on the basis of the value of sites previously sold by the respondent. he did not give any compensation for the low lying land or for the building. the district judge accepted the rate of rs. 10 / - per sq. yard as fair, reduced the amount of deductions for electric installations by rs. 5, 000 / - and allowed rs. 1, 41, 169 / - to respondent as compensation. the high court held that rate of compensation should be rs. 13 / 8 /.

tagline: M/S. Lakshmichand Baijnath vs The Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 13 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: the appellant filed a petition before the income - tax act, 1922, claiming that there had been a partition in the family on april 24, 1945. an appellant's case regarding six sums aggregating to rs. 2, 30, 346 shown in the accounts as the proceeds of the family jewels sold but the price realised therefrom was invested in the business.

tagline: Alamgir & Another vs The State Of Bihar on 14 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: appellants were charged under s. 498 indian penal code for detaining r when they knew or had reason to believe she was the wedded wife of s, with intent to have illict intercourse with her. judge reduced the sentence to a fine of rs. 50 / - each.

tagline: Bhogilal Chunilal Pandya vs The State Of Bombay on 4 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: appellant, a cashier of a company, was charged with committing criminal breach of trust. appellant objected that these notes were not admissible under s. 157 of the evidence act. the appellant said the word " statement " in. 157 means only " something that is stated " and the element of communication is not necessary.

tagline: Thakur Raghubir Singh And Others vs The State Of Ajmer (Now Rajasthan) ... on 14 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: state of ajmer ( now rajasthan ) and others ( and connected date of judgment ) act, 955, provided for vesting of all estates held by intermediaries. petitioners who filed petitions under art. 32 of the constitution of india challenging the validity of the act and, in particular ss. 8, 38 of the. act on the grounds that entry 36 of list 11 of the 479 schedule to the constitution gave power to the legislature to acquire property for purposes other than the purposes of the union.

tagline: Rameshwar Proshad Khandelwal & ... vs Commissioners Land Reforms & ... on 13 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: case no longer heard in civil war but it's not known if it was a case of civil rights abuses. the case is expected to fetch more than £80, 000 in the uk this year, according to the civil rights act. the petition was launched in the civil war in the 1950s.

tagline: S. K. G. Sugar Ltd vs Sri Ali Hassan, Chairman, ... on 4 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: bhagwati, natwarlal h. das, sudhi ranjan ( cj ) sinha, bhuvneshwar p. subbarao, k. j. sugar ltd. and their workmen represented by their unions, for adjudication to the industrial tribunal constituted by the respondent no. i. no notice was given to the appellant.

tagline: M.P. Davis vs Commissioner Of Agricultural ... on 24 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: gajendragadkar, j. 1, was the registered owner of the kaimabetta coffee estate. it appears that prior to the assessment year 1952 - 53 the appellant was registered as an individual. appellant applied for and obtained special leave to appeal to the high court.

tagline: Punjab Distilling Industries Ltd vs The Commissioner Of Income-Tax, ... on 24 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: distiller of country liquor sold liquor to licensed wholesalers. appellant was paid as an integral part of the commercial transaction of the sale of liquor in bottles and represented an extra price charged for the bottles. the appellant took a further sum from the wholesalers described as'security deposit'for the return of bottles.

tagline: Dau Dayal vs The State Of Uttar Pradesh on 24 November, 1958
summarized_judgment: the appellant was arrested for offences under ss. 420, 482, 483, 485 and 486 indian penal code and bidis alleged to bear counterfeit trade marks were seized from him. appellant raised preliminary objection before - the magistrate was barred by s. 15 of the cases.

tagline: Pandit M. S. M. Sharma vs Shri Sri Krishna Sinha And Others on 12 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: petitioner was called upon by the secretary of the patna legislative assembly to show cause before the committee of privileges of the assembly. the petitioner, the editor of the english daily newspaper searchlight of patna, was asked to show extent of the right to freedom of speech and expression under art. petitioner's application was in violation of freedom of the press.

tagline: Shri Kishori Lal vs Mst. Chaltibai on 1 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: the appellant contested the suit on the grounds that l had adopted him as his son six months before his death in addition to the oral evidence of adoption. the u. s. supreme court held the adoption was not proved and decreed the suit was not proven and decreed that the application of adoption proved.

tagline: Atma Ram vs The State Of Punjab And Others(And ... on 8 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: punjab security of land tenure act ( punj. x of 1953 ), acted as amended by act xi of 1955, act. act of 1955 sought to " provide security for the security of lands - tenure and other incidental matters " petitioners, who were granted the right to purchase land - owners, said the land - owner was entitled to the rights of land.

tagline: Chaube Jagdish Prasad And Another vs Ganga Prasad Chaturvedi on 5 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: the appellant's application to the house allotment officer under s. 5 ( 4 ) of the act for enhancement of rent and eviction act, 1947. in 1947, the homeowner increased the rent to rs. 40 per mensem on the basis of the building that was added by the new construction. the new accommodation was not a newly constructed one as the respondent had been tenant from 1938.

tagline: C. K. Achuthan vs The State Of Kerala And Others on 11 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: petitioner hidayatullah, m. das, sudhi ranjan ( cj ) das was denied equal opportunity of employment under the state of india, arts. 14, 16 of the 1, 19 ( 1 ) and 31 had been infringed. the petitioner and the co - operative milk supplies society, cannanore, had submitted tenders, and superintendent of public health.

tagline: Gummalapura Taggina ... vs Setra Veeravva And Others on 19 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: hindu law - widow in possession of husband's property - adopted son getting into possession - adoption invalid. but k's widow, who was a party to the suit, would be entitled to full ownership of her husband ’ s properties, while it was urged for the appellant's suit to fail in view of the provisions of the act.

tagline: Hukum Chand Malhotra vs Union Of India on 12 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: appellant was charged with having, contrary to rules governing conditions of his service, accepted private employment without sanction of government while he was still in government service. the appellant, a government servant, was accused of having a charge of having. but the president is now provisionally of opinion that a major penalty, viz., dismissal, removal or reduction should be enforced on you.

tagline: D. S. Garewal vs The State Of Punjab And Another on 11 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: the constitution of india, arts. 312, 392 of the constitution passed the constitution in january 1950. the appellant, who was appointed to the indian police service in 1949, held the post of superintendent of police in the punjab in 1957. the president in exercise of his powers under art. 312 ( 1 ) omitting the following therefrom, " xxx if the council of states has declared it necessary or expedient in the national interest to do so xxx "

tagline: The State Of Rajasthan vs Shri G. Chawla And Dr. Pohumal on 16 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: ajmer ( sound amplifier control ) act, 1952, was enacted by the ajmer legislative assembly. the act fell within entry no. 31 of the union list and not in the state list. judges said the act was'ultra vires the state legislature'and that the act falls within the powers of the legislature.

tagline: Haji Mohammad Ekramul Haq vs The State Of West Bengal on 16 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: haji mohammad ekramul haq was requisitioned by the respondent for the purposes of the controller of army factory accounts. the arbitrator awarded compensation of rs. 2, 581, - 8 - 0 according to the rent prevailing in the nearby property. it rejected the additional award of 10 % for potential value.

tagline: Mizaji And Another vs The State Of U.P on 18 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: the appellants had been rightly convicted and sentenced under s. 302 read with s. 149, indian penal code, 1860, ( xlv of 1860 ), and sentenced mizaji to death and the others to. imprisonment for life. the state of u. s. p. date of judgment of the case is expected to last more than two years.

tagline: Seth Badri Prasad And Others vs Seth Nagarmal And Others on 9 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: when cloth control was introduced in rewa state, 25 cloth dealers of budhar, including the 13 appellants, formed themselves into an association to collect the quota of cloth to be allocated to them and to sell it on profit. the association was established to collect quota of 15 cloth to sell on profit, but was on appeal, dismissed by the judicial commissioner.

tagline: P. V. Sivarajan vs The Union Of India And Another on 11 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: the act had for its object the regulation and control of the coir industry in public interest. it was contended that the impugned rules were inconsistent with the act nor in excess of the powers granted on the central government by s. 26 of the act. there was no provision in the act, which excluded or prohibited the application of the quantitative test.

tagline: Raja Bahadur K. C. Deo Bhanj vs Raghunath Misra And Others on 18 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: the appellant was declared elected to the orissa legislative assembly and the first respondent filed an election petition challenging the election on the ground that appellant committed the corrupt practice under s. 123 ( 7 ) ( f ) of the act. the high court held that a sarpanch was a person in the service of the government with. - in the meaning of. s. i23 ( 7. ) (. 7 ). the. appellant wasn't guilty of any corrupt practice in obtaining assistance of sarpanches.

tagline: Raghubar Sarup Nawab Jamshed Ali ... vs State Of U.P on 18 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: ali khan was the first indian to respond to the civil war in the 1950s. he was convicted of the first - degree murder of ali khan. he is now serving a five - year prison sentence for his role in the death of his wife. the case is expected to be heard in the u. s. on may 1.

tagline: Attar Singh & Others vs The State Of U. P on 17 December, 1958
summarized_judgment: petitioners challenged constitutional validity of the u. p. consolidation of holdings act. petitioners objected to these proposals and appealed to the settlement officer but to no effect. a notification was issued under s. 4 of the impugned act declaring the decision of the state government to formulate a scheme of'consolidation in respect of the area '

tagline: Narain And Two Others vs The State Of Punjab on 4 December, 1958

tagline: Attar Singh And Ors. vs The State Of U.P. on 17 December, 1958

tagline: Asa Ram vs The District Board, ... on 3 December, 1958

tagline: Maharana Shri ... vs The State Of Bombay And Others(And ... on 16 December, 1958

tagline: Atma Ram vs The State Of Punjab And Others(And ... on 8 December, 1958

tagline: C. K. Achuthan vs The State Of Kerala And Others on 11 December, 1958

tagline: Hukum Chand Malhotra vs Union Of India on 12 December, 1958
